dataset.title: Vaccine Uptake by Health District
dataset.description:
This polygon dataset summarizes the rate of uptake for the COVID-19 vaccine in Manitoba based on rural Districts and Winnipeg Community Area boundary geography.

The Winnipeg RHA is divided into twelve geographically defined Community Areas within the City of Winnipeg and the Rural Municipalities of East St. Paul and West St. Paul. Community areas were developed for the purpose of analysis and to aid in the delivery of health services.

Manitoba COVID-19 statistics are obtained from the Public Health Information Monitoring System (PHIMS) database.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)

Case Status by District:

  • RHA Code (RHACODE): This field contains a two-digit alphabetic code which uniquely identifies a specific legislatively defined RHA
  • RHA District Code (rhad): This field contains a three- or four-digit code which signifies the RHA and the individual district or community area within the RHA.
  • Code Number (code): This field contains a two-digit numeric code which identifies a specific district within an RHA.
  • RHA District Name (rhadname): This field contains a simple name for each RHA district or Winnipeg Community Area, suitable for use as a label, in English.
  • Zone Number (zone): This field contains a three-digit alphanumeric code which identifies the section of the RHA in which this district is.
  • Zone Name (zone_name): This field contains a simple name for each RHA zone.
  • New RHA Code (NewRHACODE): This field contains a two-digit numeric code which uniquely identifies a specific legislatively defined RHA
  • RHA (RHA): This field contains a simple name for each RHA, suitable for use as a label, in English.
  • Date (Date): This field contains the date and time of the last update in date format.
  • Uptake 1 dose (uptake_1): The percentage of the district or community population five years and over that have received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine.
  • Uptake 2 doses (uptake_2): The percentage of the district or community population five years and over that have received two doses of COVID-19 vaccine.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Animal Disease Investigations in Manitoba Data
dataset.description:
This table contains information relevant to animal disease investigations in Manitoba from 2012 to present, conducted by the Chief Veterinary Office (CVO). Information includes year, number of sites, number of linked sites, animal species, disease types and results. Updated on a weekly basis.


It is important that users are aware of the following caveats when reviewing data presented in the Animal Disease Investigations Dashboard:


1. Each investigation can have one or more cases involved depending on the number of herds or animals exposed. Not all disease investigations are handled the same due to a partnership approach. Diseases can be detected via surveillance, ad hoc reporting, or through other programs.


2. Rabies is a separate program. Please see Manitoba's Provincial Rabies Management Program for data related to Rabies Surveillance.


3. Certain zoonotic diseases, such as salmonella or influenza, are also captured in more detail through other means. The total occurrence of a zoonotic disease represented in this dashboard reflects occurrences where risks or exposures were deemed significant enough to warrant further investigation.

4. Historically, One Health Investigations that were predominantly focused on Public Health issues rather than Animal Health concerns were not captured in this system and will be underrepresented here.



Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • Year (Year): Year of the disease investigation
  • Number of Sites (Number_of_Sites): Number of investigation sites
  • Number of Linked Sites (Number_of_Linked_Sites): Number of sites linked to investigation sites
  • Species/Class (Species__Class): Group of animal species
  • Disease Type (Disease_Type): The type of disease that is being investigated
  • Result (Result): The outcome (positive/negative) for the corresponding animal disease investigation

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 – Daily Cases and Hospitalizations (historical)
dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date daily status information for cases and hospitalizations of COVID-19 in Manitoba. The reporting period for this data begins on Mar. 10, 2020, and covers the time period for the entire COVID-19 pandemic in Manitoba.

This dataset summarizes the COVID-19 case information as obtained from the Public Health Information Monitoring System (PHIMS), by day. PHIMS is linked to the Admissions, Discharges, Transfers (ADT) database to obtain in-hospital information on COVID-19 fatalities. Updates occur daily at 12:30 p.m. and are based on the PHIMS 4:00 a.m. data refresh and the ADT 12:00 a.m. data refresh.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)

  • Date (Date): This field contains the date for which confirmed and probable COVID-19 cases were reported in the Public Health Information Management System (PHIMS).
  • Daily Cases (Daily_Cases): This field contains the daily case numbers of COVID-19 as reported in PHIMS.
  • Cumulative Cases (Cumulative Cases): This field contains the cumulative daily case numbers of COVID-19 as reported in PHIMS.
  • Recoveries (Recoveries): This field contains the number of cumulative recoveries by day as reported in PHIMS.
  • Total Recoveries (Total_Recoveries): This field contains the number of total recoveries by day as reported in PHIMS.
  • Deaths (Deaths): This field contains the daily number of deaths in people who were reported as confirmed or probable COVID-19 cases.
  • Total Deaths (Total_Deaths): This field contains the cumulative number of deaths in people who were reported as confirmed or probable COVID-19 cases.
  • New ICU Admissions (New_ICU_Admissions): This field contains the number of new (incident number of) ICU admissions on a specific date.
  • Current ICU - Total (Current_ICU_Total): This field contains the number of individuals who have been marked as recovered from COVID or are still infectious, an active case and are currently in a hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
  • Current ICU - Active (Current_ICU_Active): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19, are still infectious and are currently in a hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
  • Cumulative ICU Admissions (Cumulative_ICU_Admissions): This field contains the number of COVID-19 cases that have been admitted to the ICU since the start of the Pandemic in March 2020.
  • New IP Admissions Total (New_IP_Admissions_Total): This field contains the number of new (incident number of) in-patient hospital admissions on a specific date.
  • Current Hospitalizations - Total (Current_Hospitalizations_Total): This field contains the number of individuals who have been marked as recovered from COVID-19, are still infectious or an active case and are currently an in-patient hospital admission.
  • Current Hospitalizations – Active (Current_Hospitalizations_Total): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19, are still infectious and are currently in an in-patient hospital admission.
  • Cumulative IP Admissions (Cumulative_IP_Admissions): This field contains the number of COVID-19 cases that have been admitted as an in-patient hospitalization since the start of the Pandemic in March 2020.
  • Non-ICU Hospitalizations - Active (Non_ICU_Hospitalizations_Active): This field contains the number of in-patient hospitalizations that are not an ICU admission on any given date.
  • Active Cases (Not Hospitalized) (Active_Cases_Not_Hospitalized): This field contains the number of active cases, not currently hospitalized on any given date.
  • Positivity Rate (Positivity_Rate): The positivity rate is the percentage of the number of positive lab tests out of the total number of lab tests performed in the last five days.
  • Daily Tests (Daily_Tests): This field contains the number of laboratory tests conducted for detecting the presence of COVID-19 on the previous day in Manitoba.
  • Cumulative Tests (Cumulative_Test): This field contains the cumulative number of laboratory tests conducted for detecting the presence of COVID-19 in Manitoba.
  • ObjectID (ObjectID): This is a set of sequential unique whole numbers that is automatically generated.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.htm

dataset.title: Case Status by District
dataset.description:
This polygon dataset summarizes the most up-to-date cases of COVID-19 in Manitoba based on Regional Health Authority (RHA), Districts, and Winnipeg Community Area boundary geography.

Within Manitoba there are five Regional Health Authorities (or "RHAs") responsible for the delivery of health services in five specific areas of the province described in the legislation as "health regions." (In practice, the terms "health region" and "RHA" are often used interchangeably to describe these geographic areas.).

In consultation with Manitoba Health, Healthy Living and Seniors, and with the Manitoba Centre for Health Policy, each of the RHAs has defined further subdivisions within each RHA . These sub-areas of each RHA generally correspond to areas of clustered population and/or service delivery. They are used to plan service delivery, and are also used to describe and analyze population health and health service use with more specificity than analysis at the RHA level could provide.

Due to the size and the total population of Manitoba's RHAs, there are two levels of subdivided RHA geography which are used for analytical and planning purposes. The smallest subdivisions used for this purpose are RHA Districts. RHA Districts within an RHA are also grouped into larger sub-areas with the RHA called RHA Zones, within each RHA District within an RHA included in precisely one of these zone.

The Winnipeg RHA is divided into twelve geographically defined Community Areas within the City of Winnipeg and the Rural Municipalities of East St. Paul and West St. Paul. Community areas were developed for the purpose of analysis and to aid in the delivery of health services.

Manitoba COVID-19 statistics are obtained from the Public Health Information Monitoring System (PHIMS) database, the Admissions, Discharges, Transfers (ADT) database, and the daily laboratory testing reports from Cadham Provincial Laboratory.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)

Case Status by District:

  • RHA Code (RHACODE): This field contains a two-digit alphabetic code which uniquely identifies a specific legislatively defined RHA
  • RHA District Code (RHA District Code): This field contains a three- or four-digit code which signifies the RHA and the individual district or community area within the RHA.
  • Code Number (Code Number): This field contains a two-digit numeric code which identifies a specific district within an RHA.
  • RHA District Name (RHA District Name): This field contains a simple name for each RHA district or Winnipeg Community Area, suitable for use as a label, in English.
  • Zone Number (Zone Number): This field contains a three-digit alphanumeric code which identifies the section of the RHA in which this district is.
  • Zone Name (Zone Name): This field contains a simple name for each RHA zone.
  • New RHA Code (NewRHACODE): This field contains a two-digit numeric code which uniquely identifies a specific legislatively defined RHA
  • RHA (RHAName): This field contains a simple name for each RHA, suitable for use as a label, in English.
  • Date (Date): This field contains the date and time of the last update in date format.
  • Last Update (Last Update): This field contains the date of the last update in string (text) format.
  • Total Tests (Total_Tests): This field contains the total number of laboratory tests conducted for detection of the presence of COVID-19 in Manitoba. The number of total tests is not currently provided at the district level.
  • Daily Tests (Daily_Tests): This field contains the number of laboratory tests conducted for detection of the presence of COVID-19 on the previous day in Manitoba. The number of daily tests is not currently provided at the district level.
  • Total Cases (Total_Cases): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 cases.
  • Active Cases (Active_Cases): This field contains the to-date number of active COVID-19 cases.
  • Recovered (Recovered): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 recoveries.
  • Deaths (Deaths): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 fatalities.
  • New Cases (New_Cases): This field contains the number of new COVID-19 cases since the previous day. The number of new cases is not currently provided at the district level.
  • Current Hospitalizations (Current_Hospitalizations): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19 and are currently hospitalized. The number of current hospitalizations is not currently provided at the district level.
  • Current ICU Patients (Current_ICU_Patients): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19 and are currently in a hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU). The number of current ICU patients is not currently provided at the district level.
  • Population (Population): The number of persons with active Manitoba health insurance as of June 2019 for the given area.
  • Rate (Cases per 100 000) (Rate): The overall incidence rate of COVID-19, expressed as number of cases per 100,000 population.
  • ObjectID (ObjectID): Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

Case Status by RHA:
  • RHA Code (RHACODE): This field contains a two-digit alphabetic code which uniquely identifies a specific legislatively defined RHA.
  • RHA (RHAName): This field contains a simple name for each RHA, suitable for use as a label, in English.
  • Nom de l'office régionale de la santé (RHANomFr): This field contains a simple name for each RHA, suitable for use as a label, in French.
  • RHA Area - total (sq km) (RHAArea): The calculated geodesic area, in square kilometres, of the area within a given RHA's boundaries.
  • RHA Area - excludes major lakes (sq km) (LandArea): The calculated geodesic area, in square kilometres, of the area within a given RHA's boundaries, with the area of major lakes excluded. For population density calculations, we recommend the use of this area value. The following major lakes have been excluded: Lake Winnipeg, Lake Manitoba, Lake Winnipegosis, and Cedar Lake.
  • Date (Date): This field contains the date and time of the last update in date format.
  • Last Update (Last Update): This field contains the date of the last update in string (text) format.
  • Total Tests (Total_Tests): This field contains the total number of laboratory tests conducted for detection of the presence of COVID-19 in Manitoba.
  • Daily Tests (Daily_Tests): This field contains the number of laboratory tests conducted for detection of the presence of COVID-19 on the previous day in Manitoba.
  • Total Cases (Total_Cases): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 cases.
  • Active Cases (Active_Cases): This field contains the to-date number of active COVID-19 cases.
  • Recovered (Recovered): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 recoveries.
  • Deaths (Deaths): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 fatalities.
  • New Cases (New_Cases): This field contains the number of new COVID-19 cases since the previous day.
  • Current Hospitalizations (Current_Hospitalizations): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19 and are currently hospitalized.
  • Current ICU Patients (Current_ICU_Patients): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19 and are currently in a hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
  • Population (Population): The number of persons with active Manitoba health insurance as of June 2019 for the given area.
  • Rate (Cases per 100 000) (Rate): The overall incidence rate of COVID-19, expressed as number of cases per 100,000 population.
  • ObjectID (ObjectID): Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 - Summary Statistics by Geography
dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date summary statistics for COVID-19 cases in Manitoba.

Statistics are obtained from the Public Health Information Monitoring System (PHIMS) database, the Admissions, Discharges, Transfers (ADT) database, and the daily laboratory testing reports from Cadham Provincial Laboratory.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • Date (Date): This field contains the date and time of the last update in date format.
  • Last Update (Last_Update): This field contains the date and time of the last update in string (text) format.
  • RHA (RHA): This field contains a simple name for each Regional Health Authority (RHA). "All" signifies all Regional Health Authorities in Manitoba.
  • Area (Area): This field contains the identifier of either the simple name for each Regional Health Authority or the code indicating a district or Winnipeg Community Area.
  • Area Name (Area_Name): This field contains the simple name for each Regional Health Authority or District or Winnipeg Community Area.
  • Total Tests (Total_Tests): This field contains the total number of laboratory tests conducted for detection of the presence of COVID-19 in Manitoba.
  • Daily Tests (Daily_Tests): This field contains the number of laboratory tests conducted for detection of the presence of COVID-19 on the previous day in Manitoba.
  • Total Cases (Total_Cases): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 cases.
  • Active Cases (Active_Cases): This field contains the to-date number of active COVID-19 cases.
  • Recovered (Recovered): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 recoveries.
  • Deaths (Deaths): This field contains the total to-date number of COVID-19 fatalities.
  • New Cases (New_Cases): This field contains the number of new COVID-19 cases since the previous day.
  • Current Hospitalizations (Current_Hospitalizations): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19 and are currently hospitalized.
  • Current ICU Patients (Current_ICU_Patients): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19 and are currently in a hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
  • Population (Population): The number of persons with active Manitoba health insurance as of June 2019 for the given area.
  • Rate (Cases per 10 000) (Rate): The overall incidence rate of COVID-19, expressed as number of cases per 100,000 population.
  • ObjectID (ObjectID): Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 Vaccine Uptake - Demographics
dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date demographic information for COVID-19 vaccine uptake in Manitoba.

Statistics are obtained from the Public Health Information Monitoring System (PHIMS) database.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • RHA (RHA): This field contains a simple name for each Regional Health Authority (RHA). "All" signifies all Regional Health Authorities in Manitoba.
  • Sex (Sex): This field indicates the sex of the individual receiving the COVID-19 vaccine.
  • Age Group (Age_Group): This field indicates the age group of the individual receiving the COVID-19 vaccine.
  • Uptake 1 dose (Uptake_1_dose): The percentage of the population in Manitoba that have received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine.
  • Uptake 2 doses (Uptake_2_doses): The percentage of the population in Manitoba that have received two doses of COVID-19 vaccine.
For more information on Manitoba’s COVID-19 vaccine campaign, please visit the following site: https://manitoba.ca/covid19/vaccine/index.html

  • New Cases (New_Cases): This field contains the number of new COVID-19 cases since the previous day.
  • Active Hospitalizations (Active_Hospitalizations): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19, are still infectious and are currently hospitalized.
  • Total Hospitalizations (Total_Hospitalizations): This field is the number of people considered to have an active case of COVID-19 and are still infectious AND the number of people considered to have recovered from COVID-19 and are no longer infectious, but still require hospitalization.
  • Active ICU Patients (Active_ICU_Patients): This field contains the number of individuals who have active COVID-19, are still infectious, and are currently in a hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
  • Total ICU Patients (Total_ICU_Patients):This field is the number of people considered to have an active case of COVID-19 and are still infectious AND the number of people considered to have recovered from COVID-19 and are no longer infectious, but still require hospitalization in an Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
  • Population (Population): The number of persons with active Manitoba health insurance as of June 2019 for the given area.
  • Rate (Cases per 10 000) (Rate): The overall incidence rate of COVID-19, expressed as number of cases per 100,000 population.
  • ObjectID (ObjectID): Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 - Outbreaks Table
dataset.description:
This table details COVID-19 outbreaks declared at assisted living facilities, provincial correctional institutions, healthcare facilities, and personal care homes/long term care facilities in Manitoba. Information provided for each outbreak includes the location category (e.g. personal care home, healthcare facility, etc.), location name, total cases, and a breakdown of total cases: staff, non-staff, active, recovered, and deaths. This outbreaks table, along with related information, can be found at the Manitoba COVID-19 Outbreaks application. The data for current outbreaks are updated each business day at 12:30 pm based on the outbreak codes extracted from the Public Health Information Management System. Cases are reported as “active” (ongoing disease), “recovered” (infection precautions/isolation no longer required), or “fatal”.

Outbreak Codes

When a group of related COVID-19 cases are identified that meet the Manitoba Health, Seniors and Active Living outbreak definition (COVID-19 Epidemiology and Surveillance Definitions), an outbreak may be called. Outbreaks can be assigned a unique Outbreak Code provided by Cadham Provincial Laboratory. Outbreak Codes are requested on a case-by-case basis by Medical Officers of Health. An Outbreak Code is helpful because it links people from the same institution or location based on a code that is attached to their laboratory test. This allows for a clear understanding of the data for a particular institution or setting. All information attached to each outbreak code is assigned to an individual’s record in the Public Health Information Management System (PHIMS) database. However, an Outbreak Code is not a requirement to learn about cases in a closed setting, such as an assisted living facility, correctional facility or personal care home.

Assisted Living Facilities

These counts relate to outbreaks declared in assisted living facilities. “Staff” refer to people who work or volunteer within the facility (e.g. health care aides, nurses). “Non-staff” refer to individuals who live at the facility. This data relates to assisted living facilities that have a declared outbreak.

Correctional Institutions

Correctional facilities are monitored because they are considered to be settings in which there is potential for rapid spread of the virus. These counts relate to cases among staff and inmate/youth residents (“non-staff”) of adult and youth provincial correctional facilities operating within Manitoba. All staff and inmate/youth resident cases are reported, regardless of a declared outbreak.

Healthcare Facilities

These counts relate to outbreaks declared in healthcare facilities, such as hospitals. “Staff” refer to people who work or volunteer within the facility (e.g. health care aides, nurses, doctors). “Non-staff” refer to individuals receiving care at the facility (e.g. inpatients or outpatients). This data relates to healthcare facilities that have an associated Outbreak Code.

Personal Care Homes/Long-Term Care Facilities

These counts relate to outbreaks declared in personal care homes (PCHs) and long-term care facilities (LTCFs). “Staff” refer to people who work or volunteer within the facility (e.g. health care aides, nurses). “Non-staff” refer to individuals who live at the facility. This data relates to PCHs/LTCFs that have an associated Outbreak Code.

Data Notes:

  • The Public Health Information Management System (PHIMS) is a surveillance and reporting tool that brings together positive laboratory results for all notifiable diseases and diseases with case and contact investigation information from the regional health authorities and or responsible organizations. PHIMS contains information on individuals such as demographics (e.g. age, region of residence and sex), risk factors, outcomes and co-infections for people living in Manitoba with a reportable disease. Data included in the interactive data application are up-to-date as of 9:30 am of the date of posting.
  • Cases are reported as “active” (ongoing disease), “recovered” (infection precautions/isolation no longer required), or “fatal”.
  • The data for current outbreaks are updated each business day at 12:30 pm based on the outbreak codes extracted from PHIMS.
  • Facility outbreaks may be reported with zero cases for several reasons:
    • Since PHIMS is relied on for the additional information necessary to identify both resident and staff cases, we are unable to identify the case(s) and update the numbers until further information is available in PHIMs. For example, this can occur when a staff member is tested in the community, not at the PCH, which can make it more difficult to pinpoint their test result to the PCH where they work.
    • In rare situations, an outbreak may be declared at a facility without a confirmed case out of an abundance of caution. For example, an outbreak may be declared if a staff member was named as a close contact to a known case outside the facility and has been in close contact with people (staff or non-staff) within the facility since their exposure.

Disclaimer

The content and format of this report are subject to change. Data are also subject to change. The COVID-19 data provided represent a snapshot at the time of reporting. Fluctuations are expected as cases are investigated and updated.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)

  • Category (Category): Category of the facility, institution, or location of the declared outbreak. E.g. personal care home, healthcare facility, correctional institution, etc.
  • Location (Location): Name of the facility, institution, or location of the declared outbreak.
  • Total (Total): The to-date number of COVID-19 cases associated with a given outbreak (or location, for correctional facilities).
  • Staff (Staff): The to-date number of COVID-19 cases among staff associated with a given outbreak (or location, for correctional facilities). “Staff” refer to people who work or volunteer at the location (e.g. health care aides, nurses, doctors, correctional officers).
  • Non-staff (Non-staff): The to-date number of COVID-19 cases among non-staff associated with a given outbreak (or location, for correctional facilities). “Non-staff” refer to individuals who reside at the location (e.g. inmates, residents, inpatients or outpatients).
  • Active (Active): The to-date number of active COVID-19 cases associated with a given outbreak (or location, for correctional facilities).
  • Recovered (Recovered): The to-date number of COVID-19 recoveries among cases associated with a given outbreak (or location, for correctional facilities).
  • Deaths (Deaths): The to-date number of COVID-19 fatalities among cases associated with a given outbreak (or location, for correctional facilities).

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date five-day test positivity rate of COVID-19 in Manitoba.

The positivity rate is the percentage of the number of positive lab tests out of the total number of lab tests performed in the last five days.

Updates occur on a daily basis. This table is built using Manitoba’s laboratory information management system, or LIMS.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • Date (Date):This field contains the reporting Date for the positivity rate calculated over the last five days.
  • Positivity Rate (Positivity_Rate): The positivity rate is the percentage of the number of positive lab tests out of the total number of lab tests performed in the last five days.
  • ObjectID (ObjectID): Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 – Daily Cases by Status and RHA
dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date daily case status information for confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Manitoba.

This dataset summarizes the COVID-19 case information as obtained from the Public Health Information Monitoring System (PHIMS), by day. PHIMS is linked to the Admissions, Discharges, Transfers (ADT) database to obtain in-hospital information on COVID-19 fatalities. Updates occur on a daily basis and is based on the PHIMS 4:00 a.m. data refresh, and the ADT 12:00 a.m. data refresh.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • Date (Date): This field contains the Date for which confirmed and probable COVID-19 cases were reported in the Public Health Information Management System (PHIMS).
  • RHA (RHA): This field contains a simple name for each Regional Health Authority (RHA). "All" signifies all Regional Health Authorities in Manitoba.
  • Daily Cases (Daily_Cases): This field contains the daily case numbers of COVID-19 as reported in PHIMS.
  • Cumulative Cases (Cumulative Cases ): This field contains the cumulative daily case numbers of COVID-19 as reported in PHIMS.
  • Active Cases (Active_Cases): This field contains the number of active cases of COVID-19, derived by the difference between cumulative daily case numbers and recoveries and deaths.
  • Recoveries (Recoveries): This field contains the number of cumulative recoveries by day as reported in PHIMS.
  • Deaths (Deaths): This field contains the cumulative number of fatalities in individuals who were reported as confirmed or probable COVID-19 cases. This field is derived from the Admissions, Discharges, Transfers (ADT) database for in-hospital fatalities, and PHIMS for in-community fatalities.
  • ObjectID (ObjectID): Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 in Schools – Statistics Summary
dataset.description:
This file contains summary statistics used for display on the COVID-19 Dashboard: School-Aged Cases and School Staff Cases in Manitoba. This file contains one row, and the summary statistics are updated when the main datasets are updated.

A school case is defined as a staff/student/volunteer affiliated with a K-12 school in Manitoba who tested positive for COVID-19 and was present in the school during the 28 days prior to the public health report date. If public health officials cannot rule out the possibility that the person was at the school during that time, then the case is classified as a school case. A school case does not necessarily mean there was acquisition or transmission at the school.

Data ‘as of’ Date (date_of_data): The effective date for which the data shown is correct. Data is extracted from the Public Health Information Management System (PHIMS).

Data ‘as of’ Date String (date_of_data_string): The effective date for which the data shown is correct. Data is extracted from the Public Health Information Management System (PHIMS) displayed as a string.

Current Cases (total_current_cases): The total number of confirmed cases (excluding ‘pending cases’ and cases not yet attributed to a school) for the two weeks preceding the data ‘as of’ date.

Current Staff Cases (total_current_cases_staff): The total number of confirmed cases amongst staff (excluding ‘pending cases’ and cases not yet attributed to a school) for the two weeks preceding the data ‘as of’ date.

Current Student Cases (total_current_cases_student): The total number of confirmed cases amongst students (excluding ‘pending cases’ and cases not yet attributed to a school) for the two weeks preceding the data ‘as of’ date.

Total Cases Since September 1 (total_cumulative_cases): The total number of confirmed cases (excluding ‘pending cases’ and cases not yet attributed to a school) since September 1 2020.

Total Staff Cases Since September 1 (total_cumulative_cases_staff): The total number of confirmed staff cases (excluding ‘pending cases’ and cases not yet attributed to a school) since September 1 2020.

Total Student Cases Since September 1 (total_cumulative_cases_student): The total number of confirmed student cases (excluding ‘pending cases’ and cases not yet attributed to a school) since September 1 2020.

Percent of Schools With Less than Five Cases (percent_schools_less_five_last_two_weeks): Of all public schools and independent schools, the percentage of schools that had between one and four cases in the previous two weeks.

Percent of Schools With Five or More Cases (percent_schools_five_or_more_last_two_weeks): Of all public schools and independent schools, the percentage of schools that had five or more cases in the previous two weeks.

School Cases as a Percentage of All Cases (school_cases_proportion_of_provincial_cases): The cumulative number of cases in schools since September 1 as a percentage of the cumulative number of cases in Manitoba since September 1, both taken at the ‘as of’ date.

Number of Schools with Cases in Last Two Weeks (number_schools_cases_last_two_weeks): The number of schools that have had a case associated with them in the 14-day period reported.

Number of Schools That Have Ever Had Cases Since September 1 (number_schools_Cases_ever): The number of schools that have had any case associated with them since September 1 2020.

Remote Learning (number_schools_recent_more_than_five): Number of schools with full remote learning. Partial remote learning is not counted in this number.

dataset.title: Manitoba Hog Prices Historical
dataset.description:
The table represents prices paid for market hogs in Manitoba and iso-wean and feeder pigs in the U.S. weekly and monthly for the current and last 10 years.

For hog price report definitions and calculations, click here.

Manitoba market hog prices are collected from major processors in Manitoba, compiled and released weekly by Manitoba Agriculture and Resource Development (ARD). Manitoba market hog prices are weighted by the volume of hogs processed, and averaged monthly. United States (U.S.) iso-wean and feeder pig prices are sourced from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) and presented in Canadian dollars (C$) using the Bank of Canada exchange rate. Monthly U.S. iso-wean and feeder pig prices are a simple average of the weekly U.S. total composite weighted average prices.

Fields included (Alias (Field name): Field description)

Year (Year): year from the selection of last ten years including current year

Period (Period): period of time to be presented on charts from the selection of Monthly and Weekly

PeriodNo (PeriodNo): serial number of period (1-12 for Monthly presentation, 1-52 for Weekly presentation)

Price (Price): Hogs price for the corresponding period of time (C$ per head for U.S. feeder pigs and iso-wean pigs, CAD per 100 kg for Manitoba market hogs)

Hog category (Hog category): category of animals from the selection of U.S. feeder pigs, U.S. iso-wean pigs, Manitoba market hogs

dataset.title: Manitoba Hog Prices Current year
dataset.description:
This table contains weekly and monthly prices paid for market hogs in Manitoba and iso-wean and feeder pigs in United States (U.S.) in current and previous years, as well as average prices for five and 10 previous years.

For hog price report definitions and calculations, click here.

Manitoba market hog prices are collected from major processors in Manitoba, compiled and released weekly by Manitoba Agriculture and Resource Development (ARD). Manitoba market hog prices are weighted by the volume of hogs processed, and averaged monthly. United States (U.S.) iso-wean and feeder pig prices are sourced from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) and presented in Canadian dollars (C$) using the Bank of Canada exchange rate. Monthly U.S. iso-wean and feeder pig prices are a simple average of the weekly U.S. total composite weighted average prices. Average five and 10-year prices are calculated as simple averages of weekly or monthly prices.

Fields included (Alias (Field name): Field description.)

Period (Period): period of time to be presented on charts from the selection of Monthly and Weekly; ;

PeriodNo (PeriodNo): serial number of period (1-12 for monthly presentation, 1-52 for weekly presentation);

Hog category (Hog category): category of animals from the selection of U.S. feeder pigs, U.S. iso-wean pigs, Manitoba market hogs;

Previous year price (Previous): animal price in corresponding period of previous year*;

Current year price (Current): animal price in corresponding period of current year*;

5-year average price (Average5): animal price in corresponding period averaged over last 5 years (excluding current year)*;

10-year average price (Average10): animal price in corresponding period averaged over last 10 years (excluding current year)*.

*(C$ per head for U.S. feeder pigs and U.S. iso-wean pigs, C$ per 100 kg for Manitoba market hogs)

dataset.title: Game Hunting Areas
dataset.description:
Game Hunting Areas (GHAs) are defined under the Hunting Areas and Zones Regulation (220/86) of The Wildlife Act (CCSM c. W130). Game Hunting Areas are used to support boundaries for species-specific hunting seasons, harvest allocations, bag limits and associated regulations. Refer to the Hunting Areas and Zones Regulation for GHA boundary descriptions.


Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description)

  • GHA (GHA): the number assigned to each Game Hunting Area
  • Shape_Length (Shape_Length): the length of the feature in internal units
  • Shape_Area (Shape_Area): area of the feature in internal units squared

dataset.title: Manitoba Cattle Prices and Head Sold
dataset.description:
This data set contains the weekly ranges of prices paid for cattle and volumes sold at Manitoba livestock auction marts in the current year.

Manitoba Agriculture and Resource Development collects Manitoba market cattle prices from local auction marts, and they are compiled and released weekly. This table contains the highest and lowest prices for different weight and sex categories of cattle and the total number of cattle sold at each auction mart, each week in the current year. Each weekly dataset contains the prices and number of head sold for each sale that occurred from Friday to Thursday (data collection usually occurs on Fridays). Historical data is not presented in this table.

This table is used in the Manitoba Cattle Prices and Head Sold dashboard.

Fields included (Alias (Field name): Field description.)

  • Week (Week): This is a serial number associated with each week in the current year. Each week contains data related to sales that occurred from Friday to Thursday, i.e. Week 1 of 2021 represents sales between Friday, Jan. 1, 2021 and Thursday, Jan. 7, 2021, with the corresponding report published by the department on Friday, Jan. 8, 2021.
  • Auction (Auction): This is the location of the auction mart.
  • Parameter (Parameter): This is the data collected from the auction marts. Legend:
    • Head sold: number of head sold
    • Bull: bulls
    • D1: D1 or D2 Cows
    • D3: D3 Cows
    • H401: heifers weighing 401 to 500 pounds
    • H501: heifers weighing 501 to 600 pounds
    • H601: heifers weighing 601 to 700 pounds
    • H701: heifers weighing 701 to 800 pounds
    • H801: heifers weighing 801 to 900 pounds
    • H901: heifers weighing more than 900 pounds
    • S401: steers weighing 401 to 500 pounds
    • S501: steers weighing 501 to 600 pounds
    • S601: steers weighing 601 to 700 pounds
    • S701: steers weighing 701 to 800 pounds
    • S801: steers weighing 801 to 900 pounds
    • S901: steers weighing more than 900 pounds
  • Measure (Measure): The price measure (low or high) indicates whether the price is the lowest or highest for the given category. This is left blank if the parameter is Head sold.
  • Value (Value): This is the number of heads if the parameter is head sold. The price is in Canadian dollars per 100 pounds for other parameters.

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID Enforcement - Weekly Ticket Statistics
dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date weekly breakdown of the number and type of tickets issued by different agencies, as part of Manitoba’s COVID-19 enforcement. Reporting for this data begins on January 4, 2021.

Manitoba's COVID-19 enforcement began on April 9, 2020. Public health officials continue to educate businesses and the public about the steps they need to take to ensure compliance with orders made under The Public Health Act and The Emergency Measures Act. However, the province has made amendments to the Preset Fines and Offence Descriptions Regulation (PFODR) under The Provincial Offences Act (POA) to allow enforcement officers to issue tickets with set fines for failure to comply with the emergency orders.

Data are obtained from Manitoba Justice and updated weekly. Data are used to populate the Manitoba COVID-19 Enforcement Dashboard.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • Week (Week): This field contains a number to represent the reporting week. It is used for data sorting purposes.
  • Date Range (Date_Range_Text): This field contains a date range in text format, identifying the reporting week for the record.
  • Tickets (Tickets): The number of tickets issued for the week.
  • Department (Department): The name of the enforcement agency.
  • Ticket Type (Ticket_Type): The type of ticket issued.
  • Ticket Fine Amount (Total_Fine_Amount): A dollar amount associated with the identified Ticket Type.
  • Type of Infraction (Type_of_Infraction): An infraction can be classified as personal or business.
For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 Enforcement - Summary Statistics
dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date weekly summary statistics for the number of tickets and warning issued, and calls made, as part of Manitoba’s COVID-19 enforcement. The total number of calls includes both, calls made by a member of the public to an enforcement agency and inspections to sites to ensure compliance with orders by authorized agencies.

Manitoba's COVID-19 enforcement began on April 9, 2020. Public health officials continue to educate businesses and the public about the steps they need to take to ensure compliance with orders made under The Public Health Act and The Emergency Measures Act. However, the province has made amendments to the Preset Fines and Offence Descriptions Regulation (PFODR) under The Provincial Offences Act (POA) to allow enforcement officers to issue tickets with set fines for failure to comply with the emergency orders.

Data are obtained from Manitoba Justice and updated weekly. Data are used to populate the Manitoba COVID-19 Enforcement Dashboard.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • Week (Week): This field contains a number to represent the reporting week. It is used for data sorting purposes.
  • Date Range (Date_Range): This field contains a text date range, identifying the reporting week for the record.
  • Weekly Sum of Tickets (Weekly_Sum_of_Tickets): The total number of tickets issued by various enforcement agencies in a given week range.
  • Weekly Sum of Warnings (Weekly_Sum_of_Warnings): The total number of warnings issued by various enforcement agencies in a given week range.
  • Weekly Sum of Calls (Weekly_Sum_of_Calls): The total number of calls made by various enforcement agencies in a given week range. The total number of weekly calls includes both, calls made by a member of the public to an enforcement agency and inspections to sites to ensure compliance with orders by authorized agencies.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 Enforcement - Cumulative Data
dataset.description:
This table contains the most up-to-date cumulative data of the number of tickets and warnings issued, and calls made, as part of Manitoba’s COVID-19 enforcement. The total number of calls includes both, calls made by a member of the public to an enforcement agency and inspections to sites to ensure compliance with orders by authorized agencies. Ticket data are further broken down by Agency.

Manitoba's COVID-19 enforcement began on April 9, 2020. Public health officials continue to educate businesses and the public about the steps they need to take to ensure compliance with orders made under The Public Health Act and The Emergency Measures Act. However, the province has made amendments to the Preset Fines and Offence Descriptions Regulation (PFODR) under The Provincial Offences Act (POA) to allow enforcement officers to issue tickets with set fines for failure to comply with the emergency orders.

Data are obtained from Manitoba Justice and updated weekly. Data are used to populate the Manitoba COVID-19 Enforcement Dashboard.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)
  • Last Update (Last_Date): This field shows the date of the most recent data update.
  • Cumulative Calls (Cumulative_Calls): Total number of calls made since enforcement began on April 9, 2020. The total number of calls includes both, calls made by a member of the public to an enforcement agency and inspections to sites to ensure compliance with orders by authorized agencies.
  • Cumulative Warnings (Cumulative_Warnings): Total number of warnings issued by various agencies since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Cumulative Tickets (Cumulative_Tickets): Total number of tickets issued by various agencies since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Cumulative Fines (Cumulative_Fines): Total sum of fines, in dollars, issued since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets - RCMP (Total_Tix_RCMP): Total number of tickets issued by RCMP since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets - Other Police Agencies (Total_Tix_OPA): Total number of tickets issued by Other Police Agencies since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets - Other Provincial Enforcement Teams (Total_Tix_OPET): Total number of tickets issued by Other Provincial Enforcement Teams since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets – G4S (Total_Tix_HPU): Total number of tickets issued by the G4S since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets - Health Protection Unit (Total_Tix_HPU): Total number of tickets issued by the Health Protection Unit since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets -Workplace Safety and Health (Total_Tix_WSH): Total number of tickets issued by Workplace Safety and Health since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets - Liquor, Gaming, & Cannabis Authority (Total_Tix_LGCA): Total number of tickets issued by the Liquor, Gaming, & Cannabis Authority since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.
  • Total Tickets - Manitoba By-law Enforcement (Total_Tix_MBE): Total number of tickets issued by Manitoba By-law Enforcement since enforcement began on April 9, 2020.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba Licensed Personal Care Homes
dataset.description:
This is a feature point layer of the 125 licensed personal care homes (PCHs) in Manitoba. All licensed PCHs in Manitoba are required to comply with minimum standards of care as set out in the Personal Care Home Standards Regulation under the Health Services Insurance Act. The Licensing and Compliance Branch of Manitoba Health Seniors and Active Living monitors compliance through regular review processes. PCH operators are required to take the necessary steps to address concerns identified in the course of reviews within specified time lines and must provide status updates until concerns have been addressed. PCH licences are reviewed and renewed annually and review findings are used to inform decision-making.

The dataset includes the following fields (Alias (Name): Description)

Regional Health Authority (Regional_Health_Authority): The name of the Regional Health Authority in which the facility is located.
Community (Community): The name of the community in which the facility is located.
Facility (Facility): The name of the licensed personal care home.
Facility Key (Facility_Key): Primary key used to query records in the Summary Reviews table.
Facility Label (Facility_Label): An abbreviated facility name suitable for use as a label in a map.
Address (Address): The street address of the facility.
Postal Code (Postal_Code): The postal code for the facility.
Phone Number (Phone_Number): The phone number for the facility.
Proprietary Status (Proprietary_Status): Refers to the ownership of the facility, either Proprietary or Non-proprietary.
Language (Language): The designated language of the facility, either English or Bilingual.
Bed (Beds): The number of beds in the facility.
Status of Licence (Status_of_Licence): The status of the facility’s license. Possible values are Unencumbered, Under Review, or With Conditions.
Owner/Operator (Owner_Operator): The individual or company that owns the facility.
Website (Website): The URL for the website of the facility.
Latitude (Latitude): The latitudinal coordinate in decimal degrees.
Longitude (Longitude): The longitudinal coordinate in decimal degrees.

This feature point layer forms part of the data for the Manitoba Personal Care Home Reporting app.

dataset.title: mb covid education 2week map
dataset.description:
This file contains one row for each public or independent school in Manitoba. First Nations schools not administered by public school divisions are excluded, as are institutional schools. This is used to populate the COVID-19 Dashboard: School-Aged Cases and School Staff Cases in Manitoba

A school case is defined as a staff/student/volunteer affiliated with a K-12 school in Manitoba who tested positive for COVID-19 and was present in the school during the 28 days prior to the public health report date. If public health officials cannot rule out the possibility that the person was at the school during that time, then the case is classified as a school case. A school case does not necessarily mean there was acquisition or transmission at the school.

An outbreak is defined as two or more school cases of COVID-19 diagnosed within a 14-day period with evidence of transmission occurring within the school. If public health officials cannot determine a connection between the cases, then no outbreak is declared.

School Name (school_name): The name of the school in English, as listed in Manitoba Education’s Educational Information System (EIS).

Cases in the Last Two Weeks (cases_last_two_weeks): The number of cases (staff and student combined) reported to Public Health in the last two weeks.

Cases Since September 1 (cases_since_1_sept): The number of cases (staff and student combined) reported to Public Health since September 1 2020 .

School Number (school_nbr): Manitoba Education four-digit school number.

School Postal Code (school_postal_code): School postal code.

Latitude (Latitude): Location of school, latitude.

Longitude (Longitude): Location of school, longitude.

Student Count (student_count): Number of students attending the school as of September 30 2019.

Division Number (div_nbr): Manitoba Education four-digit division number. Certain funded independent schools are associated with fictional divisions that are no longer relevant. These have been merged into division 0107 – Independent Schools.

Division Name (div_name): School division or district name in English. Certain funded independent schools are associated with fictional divisions that are no longer relevant. These have been merged into division 0107 – Independent Schools.

Remote Learning (school_tcount): Indicator whether or not this location utilizes full remote learning. Partial remote learning is not included in this indicator.

Total Enrolment in Division (division_enrolment_2019): Total enrolment of the division that the school is an administrative part of, as of September 30 2019.

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 and Flu - Vaccination Sites
dataset.description:
This point layer displays the location of COVID-19 and flu vaccine providers within the province of Manitoba. Vaccination sites are symbolized by their provider type, indicating whether the location is a pharmacy, medical clinic, provincial vaccine clinic, etc. Other information available for each site includes provider name, whether they are accepting appointments, address, and any special notes or restrictions on the location.

This data is populated by Manitoba Health, Seniors and Active Living.

This layer is the data behind the Manitoba COVID-19 & Flu Vaccine Finder application. The data is updated as needed.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)

  • Provider Type (Provider_Type): Type of provider. Includes Vaccine Clinic, Pharmacy, Medical Clinic and Urban Indigenous Vaccine Clinic.
  • Provider Name (Provider_Name): Official business name of the provider.
  • Status (Status): Current status of location: “Taking appointments” or “Not currently taking appointments”.
  • Date (Date): Specific to "Vaccine Clinics" - Date(s) that the location is operating.
  • Hours (Hours): Specific to "Vaccine Clinics" - Hours of operation for the location.
  • Date Updated (Date_updated): Last date this attribute was updated by the holding provider.
  • Vaccine Comments (Vaccine_Comments): Any limitations, comments or restrictions about the vaccine distribution/eligibility at this location.
  • Note (Note): Any additional notes from the provider on their location/requirements.
  • RHA Name (RHA_Name): Name of the Regional Health Authority (RHA) where the site is located.
  • Address (Address): Street address or mailing address, if applicable.
  • City (City): City or town in which the provider is located.
  • Province (Province): Province in which the provider is located. The default is "Manitoba".
  • Phone (Phone): Provider's public business phone number.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba COVID-19 - Variant of Concern Cases
dataset.description:
After November 26, 2021, Manitoba will no longer publicly report variants of concern (VOC) online or results to public health. As 98% of cases are now Delta variants there is no longer any clinical implications when this information is received.

This table contains data about confirmed COVID-19 variant of concern (VOC) cases in Manitoba.

Variants of Concern

  • Viruses like the ones that cause COVID-19 are constantly changing through mutation. New variants occur over time; sometimes the new variants emerge and disappear while others last. It is not unexpected to see cases of COVID-19 linked to VOCs in Manitoba.

  • Different variants of concern of the virus that causes COVID-19 are currently circulating in Manitoba, and globally. Initially the variants of concern included a variant called B.1.1.7, which was originally identified in the United Kingdom in fall 2020. Later on other variants of concern such as, South Africa (B.1.351) and Brazil (P.1) were detected. Recently new variant of concern have been detected that includes the Indian variant (B.1.617) and its sub-lineages (B.1.617.1, B.1.617.2, and B.1.617.3).

  • The “unspecified” variant of concern categorization refers to a variant of concern that has not yet been determined to be one specific type. Further testing may later determine an “unspecified” VOC to be related to a specific variant.

  • Public health officials continue to actively monitor and study emerging COVID-19 VOCs given their potential to:

    • Spread more quickly in the population compared to the current strain.

    • Cause more severe disease.

    • Compromise natural or vaccine induced immunity.

  • VOCs can be more difficult to control, and often require stronger or additional public health measures.

  • Information is rapidly evolving on the VOCs and their effects in Manitoba.

Data Notes

  • The Public Health Information Management System (PHIMS) is a surveillance and reporting tool that brings together positive laboratory results for all notifiable diseases and diseases with case and contact investigation information from the regional health authorities and or responsible organizations. PHIMS contains information on individuals, such as demographics (e.g. age, region of residence and sex), risk factors, outcomes and co-infections for people living in Manitoba with a reportable disease. Data included in the interactive data application are up-to-date as of 9:30 am of the date of posting.

  • Following case investigations, cases may be removed from the data totals for one of the following reasons:
    • If the investigator finds the client is out of province.
    • If the client was re-tested and it was found that they were not a case.
    • If client information was corrected.

Disclaimer

  • The content and format of this report are subject to change. Data are also subject to change. The COVID-19 data provided represent a snapshot at the time of reporting. Fluctuations are expected as cases are investigated and updated.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)

  • Outcome (Outcome): This field describes COVID-19 VOC case status. Cases are reported as "active" (ongoing disease), "recovered" (infection precautions/isolation no longer required), or "death".
  • Staging (Staging): This field describes the most likely way that the infection was acquired, as determined from the case investigation.
    • Travel = the case most likely got infected during travel.
    • Close contact of known case = the case most likely got infected by a known close contact.
    • Unknown acquisition = there is no clear source of the infection that can be associated to the case.
    • Pending further investigation = the case is still being investigated.
  • RHA (RHA): This field contains a simple name for each regional health authority (RHA).
  • Variant (Variant): This field contains the COVID-19 VOC name.
  • Cases (Cases): This field contains the to-date number of confirmed COVID-19 VOC cases reported by outcome, staging, RHA, and variant.
  • ObjectId (ObjectId): This field contains sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

This dataset is used in the Manitoba COVID-19 - Variant of Concern Cases Dashboard.

For more information on Manitoba’s response to COVID-19, please visit: https://www.gov.mb.ca/covid19/index.html

dataset.title: Manitoba Licensed Personal Care Home Summary Reviews
dataset.description:
This table contains URL links to reports on personal care home reviews completed by the Licensing and Compliance Branch of Manitoba Health, Seniors and Active Living. All licensed personal care home facilities in Manitoba are required to comply with minimum standards of care as set out in the Personal Care Home Standards Regulation under the Health Services Insurance Act. The branch monitors compliance through regular review processes. Operators of facilities are required to take the necessary steps to address concerns identified in the course of reviews within specified time lines and must provide status updates until concerns have been addressed. Licences are reviewed and renewed annually and review findings are used to inform decision-making.

The table includes the following fields (Alias (Name): Description)

  • Regional Health Authority (Regional_Health_Authority): The name of the Regional Health Authority in which the facility is located.
  • Community (Community): The name of the community in which the facility is located.
  • Facility (Facility): The name of the licensed personal care home.
  • Facility Key (Facility_Key): Primary key used to link this table with the feature point layer Licensed Personal Care Homes.
  • Review Date (Review_Date): The date the review was conducted.
  • Review Type (Review_Type): The type of review conducted. Possible values are Regular Standards, Unannounced, Modified, Pre-Opening, or Other.
  • Summary Link (Summary_Link): The URL link to the report.

This table forms part of the data for the Manitoba Personal Care Home Reporting app.

publisher.name: Licensing and Compliance Branch of Manitoba Health, Seniors and Active Living

dataset.title: Manitoba LiDAR Tracker
dataset.description:
LiDAR (Light Detection and Ranging) is a remote sensing technology that uses lasers to collect accurate, continuous elevation data over relatively large areas. These data are essential for activities such as forestry, flood risk management, land use planning, and natural resources management. The Manitoba Government is increasingly acquiring LiDAR data across the province.


This layer was created on August 5, 2009 by Manitoba Sustainable Development and was updated on August 9, 2021.


To download LiDAR data from the Manitoba Land Initiative (MLI) site, follow this link:

https://mli2.gov.mb.ca/dems/index_external_lidar.html

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)

ObjectID (OBJECTID) - Automatically generated feature number
Acquired (ACQUIRED) - LiDAR data capture date
Contractor (CONTRACTOR) - Contractor name
Contributor (CONTRIB) - Manitoba Government department
Name (NAME) - Dataset name
Cellsize (CELLSIZE) - Raster DEM cell size
MLI (MLI) - Data available for download on the Manitoba Land Initiative site

dataset.title: Manitoba Near-Urban Centrefire Prohibition Area
dataset.description:
The Near-Urban Centrefire Prohibition Area (NUCPA) is a provincially-regulated prohibition of centrefire rifles for white-tailed deer hunting. This prohibition encompasses all or portions of the Rural Municipalities (RMs) of Headingley, Rosser, Rockwood, St. Andrews, West St. Paul, East St. Paul, St. Clements and Richot. Under the General Hunting Regulation (351/87) of The Wildlife Act (c. W130), no person shall have a rifle requiring a centrefire cartridge in his or her possession while hunting deer in lands identified as a Near Urban Wildlife Zone on Plan No. 20350 or 20525 filed in the office of the Director of Surveys.

Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description)

  • FID (FID): sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated

  • Description (Description): definition and description of the Near-Urban Centrefire Prohibition Area

  • Shape_Length (Shape_Length): length of the feature in internal units

  • Shape_Area (Shape_Area): area of the feature in internal units squared

dataset.title: Manitoba Public Sector Compensation Disclosure
dataset.description:
Information on all public sector employees who were paid $75,000 or more in the year beginning in 2020 and are subject to the Public Sector Salary Disclosure Act.

The Manitoba government discloses annually the compensation paid in the fiscal year or in the calendar year to a person who is a member of the civil service or who holds a specified public office if their annual compensation is equivalent to or exceeds the minimum legislated threshold for disclosure.

This table lists those individuals defined above, along with related information described in the ‘fields’ below. This table is presented in the Manitoba Public Sector Compensation Disclosure application, which is a user-friendly interactive tool that adds functionality such as filtering, search, and data export.

Fields included (Alias (Field name): Field description.)
  • Sector (Sector): A standard set of sectors that will allow for searching and categorizing similar organizations.
  • First Name (First_Name): First name or first initial based on the past practice of the organization
  • Last Name (Last_Name): Last name or badge number based on the past practice of your organization
  • Total Compensation (Total_Compensation): Total compensation that includes employment contract, total value of all cash and non-cash salary or payments, allowances, bonuses, commissions and perquisites.
  • Job Title (Job_Title): Job title, position name or position category, based on the past practice of the organization.
  • Employer (Employer): This field will contain the name of the employer.
  • Department/Region (Department_Region): This is an optional field for organizations that currently report department
  • Reporting Year (Reporting_Year): The fiscal year or calendar year in which the reporting period ended. (e.g. a fiscal year ending March 2021 and a calendar year ending December 2021 will both be listed as 2021)
  • Reporting Schedule (Reporting_Schedule): This field will indicate which of the two reporting calendars the information reflects, based on the past practice of the organization.
For more information on proactive disclosure by the Manitoba government, please visit the following site: https://www.gov.mb.ca/openmb/infomb/index.html

Have thoughts on how this tool could be improved? Visit EngageMB.ca/OpenMB

dataset.title: Special Conservation Areas
dataset.description:
The purpose of this dataset is to show the boundaries of all Special Conservation Areas (SCA) in Manitoba, as designated by the Designation of Wildlife Lands Regulation (171/2001) under The Wildlife Act (C.C.S.M. c. W130). Special Conservation Areas are designated to conserve and protect particular species and habitats throughout Manitoba. The Use of Wildlife Lands Regulation (77/99) determines what activities are prohibited within each Special Conservation Area.


Boundaries are drawn based on CAD files from the official Director of Surveys Plan stated in the regulation.


Fields included (Alias (Field Name): Field description.)


FID (FID): Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated

Name (NAME): Special Conservation Area name

D of S Plan (DofS): Director of Surveys plan number

Area_HA (AREA_HA): Area in Hectares

Species (SPECIES): Species name

publisher.name: Wildlife and Fisheries Branch, Manitoba Sustainable Development

dataset.title: Red River Flood - 2011
dataset.description:
This dataset shows the extent of peak overland flooding in the Red River Valley in 2011. Data is based on RADARSAT – 1 satellite imagery. During processing, the raw dataset was resampled to 12.5 meter pixel resolution, then classified using PCI Geomatica software which is a specialized software designed to manipulate space born imagery. The final output depicting the flooding boundary is available as a TIFF or Shapefile.

Launched in November 1995, RADARSAT-1 was a Canadian-led project which provided useful information to both commercial and scientific users in such fields as disaster management, agriculture, cartography, hydrology, forestry, oceanography, ice studies and coastal monitoring. Equipped with a powerful synthetic aperture radar (SAR) instrument, it acquired images of the Earth day or night, in all weather and through cloud cover, smoke and haze. As of March 2013, the satellite was declared non-operational and is no longer collecting data.

Many applications were developed to take advantage of RADARSAT-1 capacity for detecting the presence of water. These included monitoring flooding and the build-up of river ice, and mapping the melting of snow-covered areas. When used for flood monitoring, RADARSAT-1 data helped assess the impact of flooding, predicted the extent and duration of floodwaters, analyzed the environmental impact of water diversion projects, and developed flood mitigation measures.

Fields Included:

FID: Internal feature number

NAME: Flooded area name

AREA_SQKM: Size of flooded area

dataset.title: Manitoba Road Network 2017
dataset.description:
The 2017 Manitoba Road Network was created by Manitoba Infrastructure --> Highway Engineering--> Highway Planning and Design. The department’s linear referencing system (LRS) uses Control Sections as a linear referencing method (LRM). The LRM is the digital representation of the Highway Network in Manitoba. The features indicate highway number and highway identity. This data was corrected using 1:60,000 digital ortho aerial photography dated from 1991-1998. Linear features have been updated on a yearly basis using GPS data, CAD files and 50cm imagery from 2007-2014, and is considered accurate to two-to-seven metres. Please note that this feature layer primarily contains only the roads that Manitoba Infrastructure is responsible for, i.e. Provincial Trunk Highways, Provincial Roads and Access Roads. However, you may also see Earth Roads (under construction) or Other roads (such as those passing through national parks and are federal responsibility).

A newer version of this data is available: Manitoba Road Network 2018.



Field List - FIELD NAME (Field Alias (i.e. display name)) in parenthesis)

OBJECTID (OBJECTID) - Sequential, unique whole numbers are automatically generated.
SHAPE (SHAPE) - A field to hold geometry information.
ID (ID) - Unique Identifier generated by Oracle.
CS_ID (Control Section ID) - Non unique identifier linking segment to its respective control section.
ROAD_NO_SIGNED (Road Number Signed) - The road number. Note though, that in the case of co-routes, the lower highway number appears. This is a text field and differs from ROAD_NO only where there are city routes, for example 1A.
ROAD_LOCATION (Road Location) - Access Road locations.
DESCRIPTION (Road Description) - A text description of the start and end locations of each segment.
CS_KEY (Control Section Key) - An information rich key containing Region (two digits), Road Number (three digits), Section number (three digits), the Road Type (one character), and direction of travel (one character).
REGION_NO (MI Region) - The Manitoba Infrastructure region the segment is in. Regions 1-5.
ROAD_NO (Road Number) - The road number. Note co-routes will have the lesser highway number.
SECTION_NO (Section Number) - The control section's section number.
START_KM (Start Kilometre (KM)) - The beginning of the Control Section (always zero).
END_KM (End Kilometre (KM)) - The number of kilometres to the end of the Control Section.
LENGTH_KM (Length Kilometres (KM)) - End Kilometre minus the Start Kilometre.
ROAD_TYPE (Road Type) - The road type, i.e. PTHs, PRs, and Access Roads (Earth roads under construction may also be included).
ROAD_DIRECTION (Road Direction) - A = ahead direction on a divided highway (i.e. following the digitizing direction), B = Back direction on a divided Highway (i.e. against the digitizing direction, and U= an undivided highway.
ROAD_IDENTITY (Road Identity) - Road identity i.e. Provincial Road, Earth Road, Access Road and Other Road.
NATIONAL_HIGHWAY_CLASS (National Highway Classification) - The national highway classification standard.
START_DATE (Start Date) - The date the segment was created in the database.
INVENTORY_YEAR (Inventory Year) - The year the road segment was opened to the public.
SHAPE_Length (Segment Length) - An automatically generated length field based on geometry.
